attributes.action: Pass legislation to abolish the payment of full council tax on probate property
attributes.background: It seems that councils are now charging 100% council tax on probate properties, irrespective of whether efforts are being made to sell or rent them. Legislation, it seems, will allow them to charge 150% or even 200% next year. This is immoral and unfair and nothing more than another unfair tax.

attributes.action: Stop employment agencies using incremental holiday pay as part of basic rate.
attributes.background: Recruitment agencies, particularly within the construction industry, agree a basic rate and then make that rate up of a lower basic rate up of a lower rate plus incremental holiday pay. This is common practice, but the law clearly states that holiday pay must be a "true addition" to the basic rate.

attributes.action: Raise UK Legal Limit of Stakes For Poker In Pubs To £10 & £20 In Members Clubs
attributes.background:
The gambling act 2005 states: 
Low stakes poker is permitted in pubs, with stakes kept to a maximum of £5 per player, with a £100 max pot per premises per day. 
Low stakes poker in social clubs, with the correct permit, allows a maximum of £10 per player £250 total pot per premises per day
attributes.additional_details:
We're petitioning to change this law to the following:
Low stakes poker to be permitted in pubs with stakes kept to: £10 Maximum per player with no maximum pot, in social clubs: £20 maximum per player no maximum pot (modify the gaming permit licence)
stake limits should now be raised as inflation no longer reflects the outdated limits set in the gambling act 2005 & an unrestricted maximum pot size
We believe that this change to the law would also benefit all UK pubs who are struggling to survive

attributes.action: 10 year automatic sentence for carrying a knife
attributes.background: Anyone caught carrying a knife should be given a standard 10 year jail sentence.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to shoot rabbits in the UK.
attributes.background: My rabbit got shot by a farmer whilst it was out in the field whilst i watching him. And it could happen to a lot more people and if you have a pet rabbit it might get shot.

attributes.action: Increase wage for qualified level 3 nursery assistants and early years educators
attributes.background: Nursery assistants and early years educators follow the same EYFS targets as a reception class teacher. We are now required to have specified knowledge of children's learning and development. It is no longer 'just' childcare. We are teachers.
attributes.additional_details: Nursery Assistants and early years educators perform a similar job to that of a reception class teacher. We must ensure children are learning and developing at a rate deemed age appropriate. We must carry out rergular assessments on the children, and facilitate learning environments and activities based on each individual childs needs. We need to have in depth knowledge of the Early Years Foundation Stage and are usually required to be qualified.

attributes.action: Review the exempted conditions and ages for NHS prescription charges
attributes.background:
The list of exempt conditions and age limits have not been reviewed and inequalities now exist.
1. Some life-long life-threatening conditions make sufferers eligible for free prescriptions even when not related to their condition, others receive no support.
2. The age limit of 60 is out of date.
attributes.additional_details:
1. Some of the biggest killers are not currently covered by exemptions such as heart disease. This can mean that people may miss medication to keep them well.
2. The current system encourages those exempt to visit a Dr to obtain prescriptions for minor illnesses when medication is available over the counter. This costs the NHS time and money.
3. As retirement ages increase and people are working longer it is logical that other benefits should remain aligned to the same age.

attributes.action: Give British people a say in our post-referendum relationship with the EU
attributes.background: The EU referendum gave the option of leaving or remaining in the EU. The options in reality are more nuanced and there is a risk of the British populace getting an unsatisfactory outcome. Given the lies of the pre-referendum campaigning we need honesty about the future of Britain and further say.
attributes.additional_details:
We need to know, and have a say on:
Whether further austerity measures might be necessary after leaving the EU: www.just-fair.co.uk/#!United-Nations-Austerity-policies-breach-the-UK%E2%80%99s-international-human-rights-obligations/qbw0c/577384fa0cf231749dc9f955
How immigration will be affected www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-37271420
Whether the NHS will be better off by £350 million per week
Whether the United Kingdom will split up
How our successful science base will be protected

attributes.action: Ban group interviews for all job applicants in the UK
attributes.background:
In the harsh times we live in, employment and specifically, unemployment is one of the most painful things a person can face.
The indignity of group interviews where people are made to beg around a table for jobs, is unfair.
We need to empower jobseekers, not crush them and ban group interviews.
attributes.additional_details:
Group interviews are by many seen as a lazy recruitment practise, to root out 'unworthy' candidates quickly.
In many cases, I find group interviews to be discriminatory and unfair to certain demographics.
Paid employment is and should be for everyone.
One of the major flaws with group interviews is that introverted personality types are left out in the cold. 
We need to introduce a fairer system that forces employers to evenly and fairly judge ALL potential job candidates.

attributes.action: Change length of time that offences stay on a persons criminal record to 10 yrs
attributes.background: If an offence stays on your record for life you're punished for life. The law should be changed so that if no further crimes are committed after 10 years the offence should be removed from there basic record. Enhanced checks for work places with children/vulnerable adults should stay permanently.
attributes.additional_details: Any offence with a 30 month+ sentence stays on record for life regardless of the type of crime/number of offences committed. Yes people need to be punished for breaking the law but if there sentence is served and they commit no further crimes they should be able to move on and build a life. People cannot get jobs because of their record and end up re-offending, homeless and with mental health issues. Changing the law will reduce crime rates, improve peoples well-being.

attributes.action: Change The General Election Voting System From FPTP To Instant-Runoff Voting
attributes.background: Hello, I am Emmanuel and I am 13 years old and came across a video on YouTube that displayed how bad the first past the post voting system is. In its simplest form FPTP is basically winner takes all. In the general election the Conservatives won 36.9% of the votes but they have 100% of the power.
attributes.additional_details:
I want to change the the the general election voting system from FPTP to IRV because in IRV there is definitely a majority winner so most people who vote will at least be moderately happy.

This YouTube video explains how bad FPTP is: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=s7tWHJfhiyo

This YouTube video explains how much better IRV is: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3Y3jE3B8HsE

attributes.action: Suspend wage reviews for senior civil servants until after brexit negotiations
attributes.background: Civil servants shouldn't need motivating to do their job of backing British interests but unfortunately they have been so intermingled with the EU for so long. They could be inclined to drag thing's out hoping for a new Pro EU government or a second referendum.
attributes.additional_details: So I suggest halting all senior service pay a promotion reviews until after the brexit process has been completed with a cut off date of 2019 a full year before the next generation election. Then the retrospective senior service reviews will be based on past brexit performance not a half hearted effort of the reluctant

attributes.action: Anti Flash Hoods to be Mandatory Under SOLAS Regs
attributes.background: Ammend SOLAS Regulations to make the issue of Anti Flash Hoods a mandatory requirement as part of ships fire fighting equipment

attributes.action: Ask this Government to consider issuing a medal to all serving armed forces.
attributes.background: I consider anyone serving their country for security and safety reasons should be acknowledged by means of a medal of service for their dedication and support to make this a safer and better World for us all to live and work in as a show of appreciation.

attributes.action: An annual National Sports Day to grow participation in sport & physical activity
attributes.background: One day a year should be designated a National Sports Day (#sportsday). Saturday 27th August 2016 saw the #IAmTeamGB campaign hold free events around the country to encourage people to participate in sport and physical activity. This should become a government supported annual national event.
attributes.additional_details:
In December 2015 Tracey Crouch MP Minister for Sport, Tourism and Heritage launched 'Sporting Future: A New Strategy for an Active Nation', encouraging sport and physical activity as a national priority. Shortly after, Jennie Price Chief Executive, Sport England launched the new 2016-2021 strategy 'Sport England: Towards An Active Nation'.

We need an annual National Sports Day to bring these strategies to life and to capitalise on Team GB & Paralympics GB's potential to inspire the nation.

attributes.action: Ban all HGVs from the third lane of all motorways
attributes.background: Motorway expansion was meant to increase traffic flow but, with lorries using lanes 1 2 and 3, traffic bunches up causing congestion

attributes.action: Consolidate mobile telephone infrastructure networks under one umbrella company
attributes.background: Many of us consumers choose a mobile provider based on coverage in the areas where we live and work. But when we travel we often find connectivity is poor (or non-existent) in certain areas if we are customers of the wrong provider.
attributes.additional_details: If the network infrastructure were to become owned by one umbrella company, then we could have excellent coverage no matter with which provider we were customers. The providers would then have a similar business relationship with the umbrella company as train operators have with Network Rail, or broadband providers have with BT Openreach. In attracting customers, providers could no longer rely on coverage, but would need to find innovative ways to be competitive.

attributes.action:
make it mandatory to show on ALL products:
- manufacturer
- origin
attributes.background:
Please make it mandatory for all products sold in the UK to display
- manufacturer name
- country of origin
this should apply to products sold under supermarkets' name as well.
for example 
fridge from electronic shop chain named Sandstorm does not show manufacturer and its country of origin!

attributes.action: Address the rise in incidences of dangerous driving on UK roads.
attributes.background: There is a lack of deterrent for dangerous drivers on UK roads. Speeding, illegal manoeuvring and blatant disregard for the Highway Code seem to have become common-place. The UK needs to rethink it's reliance on speed cameras, speed humps, etc. and begin enforcing speed and dangerous driving laws.

attributes.action: Make all drivers carrying passengers for reward take the DVSA Practical & CPC
attributes.background: At present it is optional if licensing authorities make new hackney/ph drivers take a dvsa test. I call for all drivers present and new of any licensing borough to ensure all drivers complete a dvsa practical, hazard perception & cpc. All other professional drivers have to and only equal they do to.
attributes.additional_details: Road safety is becoming harder to tackle across the UK, if we lead the way in Europe on how to maintain road safety by ensuring all drivers who drive for hire & reward take the steps as bus & lorry drivers have then we are one step closer to ensuring safety of passengers in any Taxi/PH vehicle & other road users for social, domestic, pleasure, commercial & business use too. Where the public are concerned this is vital for road safety and passenger reassurance that drivers are trained correctly.

attributes.action: Create more opportunities to further vocational subject skills in state schools.
attributes.background: In state education here in the U.K our youth have next to no chances to properly further their vocational skills, e.g dance! Many schools not offering a thing in some of these areas that could potentially be the child's gift in life! For many school is the only outlet for them to progress in this.
attributes.additional_details: Focus on sporting and academic departments take away sometimes completely from the vocational or artistic side. If that is a career a youth would want to pursue then it is the EDUCATION systems duty to EDUCATE the students on such matters! But no input or teaching on these skills are taught, hindering the abilities of our youths and holding them back from their potential, MANY, MANY people have a skill in vocational activities and subjects that could lead to a career in it.

attributes.action: Automate all trains so there are no longer drivers or manual door openers.
attributes.background: It is ludicrous in 2016 that huge swathes of the country should be held to ransom by union action over something as silly as who controls the doors - personnel are paid far too much to press a button and move a lever. The technology has existed since the 70s to automate all of this.
attributes.additional_details: In 2016 Train Drivers hold the country to ransom whenever they want a pay bump, or even more favourable conditions. The average transport for London driver earns £55k, in the south, the average is £39k. No part of their job requires a human. It's time for progress, guarantee these people jobs until retirement, hire no new drivers - and slowly automate away the skill gap so that the current drivers don't suffer, but that no drivers can come along to make the rest of the country suffer.

attributes.action: Allow fathers to stay with poorly babies in hospitals
attributes.background: on 3rd August 2016 my 4 day old daughter was rushed to hospital because she wasn't breathing properly, once we were seen we were sent to a ward, where I (Father) was told I had to leave her and go home because the ward was for women.
attributes.additional_details: I was forced to leave my baby in the hospital because they ward staff would not allow me to stay with her. I believe men should be allowed to stay with their children regardless!

attributes.action: To start the Tax Office and Government standard tax year from the 1st January.
attributes.background: The start date for the Fiscal Year of the 6th April was fixed when the UK moved to the Gregorian Calendar and is based on the antiquated "Quarter Days". Computers and Spreadsheets work best with whole months and years.  It is time that the Government Fiscal year is brought into the 21st century.

attributes.action: Make politics more inclusive for people with disabilities.
attributes.background:
I want to make politics and  careers  in local and central government more easier and accessible for people with disabilities and learning difficulties.
I would like to see more people with disabilities involved in policy making and government positions.

attributes.action: Make prisons rehabilitation centres to lower crime caused by released inmates.
attributes.background:
People who are put into prison are being released and causeing eaither the same crime or a worse one. 
Other countries have resorted to this tactic of instead of keeping inmates locked in like animals they give the a working environment where they can become better working citizens.

attributes.action: Prevent motorway central reservation grass cutting
attributes.background: The cost in time and lost commerce is immense and so un-necessary, it's naturally sown wild grasses and flowers (and helps prevent glare at night from headlamps on the opposite carriageway). Three times this week I have been delayed by these works totalling 3 hours in delays.

attributes.action: Stop the creation of retirement honours and dissolution honours.
attributes.background: Using these honours to reward friends and party backers brings the whole honours system into disrepute.

attributes.action: Invest in Tidal Lagoon Power instead of Nuclear - they are green & reliable!
attributes.background: Tidal power is totally reliable and always available. It does not rely on ANY fuel, the wind, or the sun. There is NO waste, it is totally green and works 24/7/365. The tide timing is different in different places, so there are no big gaps. If designed properly, they could be virtually invisible.
attributes.additional_details: Britain has a big coastline, and the proposed tidal lagoon in Wales could be the ideal starting point and testing ground, though I personally think the artist's impression is awful and I think the whole thing should be hidden away out of sight, which it could be if designed properly, a bit like the Cruachan hydroelectric generating station in the mountains in Scotland.

attributes.action: send an allied task force to eliminate ISIS
attributes.background: ISIS must be destroyed before they can kill more innocent civilians.

attributes.action: Stop banks charging,for IN THE RED on pensioners & those on low incomes,
attributes.background: Fed up on this action, continually in the red simply because of these £32 deductions!
attributes.additional_details: Now we are enforced to get paid by the Banks, this did not happen when we were paid by the Post Office, with our Pension Books

attributes.action: Stop media from publicising the nationality of criminals to prevent prejudice
attributes.background: If a nationality is associated with a horrible act of violence in the media, it is easy for readers to then associate people of that nationality with acts of terror and violence. This can make innocent people of that nationality very prone to racism and prejudice.

attributes.action: Switch the UK timezone to match the rest of Europe
attributes.background: The rest of western Europe has changed their timezone to UTC + 1 and since these countries are extremely close, it would be sense from a trade, enterprise and consumer point of view that this should be changed for the better.

attributes.action: Let motorcycle riders over 25, drive cars up to 1.0 without L plates and test
attributes.background: I can drive safely and confidently, and so can all other motorcyclists that are old enough to do this maturely. Ie over 25 year olds. In a low powered car it is going to be far safer in poor weather, rain. Wind,  winter conditions etc than on a motorcycle without the hassle and cost of another test

attributes.action: Remove the engine size limit on A1 motorcycle license
attributes.background:
Currently the A1 license has three limitations
* maximum 11 kW
* power-to-weight ratio not more than .1 kW
* must not be more than 125 cc
Whereas the A2 license only has two
Some motorscooters/motorcycles may have over 125cc yet still produce under 11 kW yet adhere to the power limit set by A1
attributes.additional_details:
For example, these currently sold vehicles:

Piaggio Vespa PX150
LML Star 151
LML Star 200 

adhere to the power-to-weight ratio and kW limitations of the A1 license.  Changing the A1 criteria to remove the engine size limit brings it in-line with the A2 license (which is also without engine size limit) and gives a further incentive to pass the A1 test rather than ride on a L-plate under a CBT thus improving road safety

attributes.action: Amend the planning rules away from favouring development
attributes.background: Developers seemingly put forward a massive plan for development and consult only a few neighbouring roads, plus put up a couple of laminated notices. Local councils can put out local plan consultations with no publicity. They should both be required to inform a far larger section of local population
attributes.additional_details: Planning rules seem to favour rich developers against local objections. This should be sorted so that development plans can no longer be released with minimal publicity and fanfare, and then developers or Local councils who want massive development to occur claim that minimal protest counts as approval for their plans

attributes.action: Ban public transport peak fares, especially on suburban commuter routes.
attributes.background: The UK is one of the few countries in the world where commuter public transport users suffer a peak fare system, with transport often owned by foreign interests. Commuters are essentially being penalised and profited from unnecessarily as they go to work, often making car usage more attractive.
attributes.additional_details:
Budapest - 80p per individual suburban bus or underground journey any time of day 
Kuala Lumpar -  23p per stop on underground Metro (modern air-conditioned Siemens trains) any time of day
Barcelona - £1.80 individual bus or underground journey any time of day
Lisbon - individual journey bus on-board fare - £1.50 any time of day
Melbourne - all-zone 2-hour tram or bus ticket, £2 any time of day
Bangkok - daily any time Skytrain pass £2.60 (Bangkok is a very big city of 12 million people!)

attributes.action: Final Leader elections in Government or Opposition should be by national vote.
attributes.background: Parlimentary leadership elections are decided by a small fraction of the electorate. This could see a vastly different Prime Minister or leader of the Opposition than the electorate intended to put in power and could in instances give rise to instability at a time when greater stability is required.

attributes.action: Make It Complusory For Every Biker To Have A Helmet Cam!
attributes.background: Loosing somebody that is close to you is never easy. Epecially when it may seem like you don't have any closure to what happened to them. I think that it ALL bikers should wear helmet cams so should the worst happen to them the family can be justified and it could also make the inquest easier.

attributes.action: Giving food brought to concerts to homeless so that none goes to waste.
attributes.background: Having recently changed my eating habits and diet that I was going to take some oats and dried fruit at a concert to enjoy as I hoped to sneak them through, in retrospect this was silly but I was still appalled that they simply threw it away despite everything I had being perfectly edible!

attributes.action: We should have a cross party coalition to negotiate our exit from the EU.
attributes.background:
Our exit from the EU should be negotiated with at least two members from the Brexit camp.
This isn't just a petition aimed at people who voted Leave, these negotiations affect all of us, so please sign this petition and let's get the right people in the negotiations to get the right deal for us!

attributes.action: Lower the age of sexual consent to 14 if both parties are under 16
attributes.background: I would like action on this petition because I feel that sexual consent laws are outdated. I feel as if sexual consent should be legal (if both under 16 and over 14)  like a "Romeo and Juliet" Law like they have in other countries. I think this would help teenagers feel better about sexual consent.

attributes.action: A General election before October and summer recess in parliament cancelled?
attributes.background:
1. For there to be a change in the law with immediate effect to enable a general election.
2. For parliamentary summer recess to be cancelled to enable resolution of Brexit.
3. A change in the law to separate financial services from electoral register to enable all and the young to vote.
attributes.additional_details: The 1st two articles in this are very much self explanatory, however article 3' is specifically designed to ensure those who due to debt collectors having access to the electoral registration system, so can track those poor people down who were victims of the GEC, can finally clear house in parliament and punish those responsible and not the immigrants blamed for the countries mess.  Also article 3' will see the law change to make it easy for the UK's young to vote by allowing temp registration.

attributes.action: Add Black English to the national census
attributes.background: In England and Wales, non-white ethnic groups, as such, are not offered the standard option of including ‘English’ as part of their ethnic group: they’re officially classified only as ‘Black British’, ‘Asian British’, etc., and not ‘Black English’ or ‘Asian English’.
attributes.additional_details: By contrast, black and Asian persons living in Scotland are permitted to identify as ‘Black Scottish’ and ‘Asian Scottish’.English people" are both a nation and an ethnic group, having white skin is not a requirement.

attributes.action: N.u.t striking should be illegal....
attributes.background: they have 91.7% wanting to strike with only a 24.7% overall turnout so the minority of disruptive teachers cause chaos across the country
attributes.additional_details: N.u.t claim that this is partly due to school funding which I find staggering as every child at our primary school has use of an iPad for example. regarding hours worked is also ridiculous it is well known that teachers get more annual leave than any other proffesion so to quote a 60 hour week is proposer oust if they calculated there hours worked over a year it would be significantly less than the average worker doing between 40 and 60 hours a week with only 20 days leave

attributes.action: Make panel van speed limits the same as cars.
attributes.background:
Speed limit for vans on an A road is 50mph - the same as a lorry.
This was set in 1982 when vans did not have disc brakes, ABS, etc.
An increase to 60mph would help with traffic flow and stop dangerous overtaking of vans.

attributes.action: To remove the copyright laws in communal rooms in sheltered housing .
attributes.background: if you live in a sheltered housing building , and want to watch a video / dvd in the communal room with other residents you have to pay a copyright fee of over £400 a year these people are all over 75 all have tv licences for there flats so why should they have to pay to watch in the communal room .
attributes.additional_details: Stop robbing the retired ,  old aged person and start giving a little back .

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for schools to teach all kinds of religion in schools equally
attributes.background: Schools are currently teaching religious studies or religious education to our children which is heavily based on Christianity. If it was compulsory to teach all religions and cultures our kids would have more understanding and be more accepting to people with different beliefs reducing segregation.
attributes.additional_details: Recent political movements have lead to a 52 percent rise in race related reports. I believe this starts at home and in school. If we educate our children in school about every religion we can they will develops educated views and become more tolerant and accepting of others. This is so very important to our multi cultural society and progression as humans that we need to get this movement to change the way we teach.

attributes.action: Give all UK Residents with NI number a vote. No taxation without representation.
attributes.background:
At 16 someone can legally leave school, get a job and pay tax. But they are denied a vote in General Elections on how that tax is spent.

The same is true for hard-working UK residents without UK citizenship. 

To address this iniquity give everyone with a National Insurance number a vote.
attributes.additional_details:
Current eligibility rules for voting in General Election (Electoral Commission)
http://www.electoralcommission.org.uk/i-am-a/voter/registering-to-vote-and-the-electoral-register

Current eligibility rules for National Insurance number (HMRC)
https://www.gov.uk/apply-national-insurance-number

attributes.action: Stop parties from supplying 'helpful' questions to ask the PM.
attributes.background: The party in power circulates 'helpful' questions to ask the PM during PM's questions. The number of questions allowed to be asked is limited, therefore these 'helpful' questions are being asked instead of Mp's asking important constituency and national matters.
attributes.additional_details:
Inside the Commons 2015 Season 1 Episode 1 shows this point perfectly and the times stated below explains exactly what we need to stop to allow more important issues being brought up during PMQ's.

Yet another reason why the public feel so wary of politicians, they are constantly wasting time and squandering the chance to reply to real topics, purely for self-gratification.

40:33 - 43:55
